algorithm_technique: Construct palindromes from the left half and check for divisibility by two n-digit numbers.
Iterate through possible sums of two n-digit numbers and derive palindrome structure.
problem_summary_simple: Find the largest palindrome that is a product of two n-digit numbers, return modulo 1337.
problem_summary_technical: Generate palindromes and check if they are products of two n-digit numbers, optimizing by considering divisibility properties.
key_insights: Palindromes can be constructed by mirroring their first half.
The problem constraints (n <= 8) suggest that brute-forcing palindromes is feasible.
Modulo arithmetic is applied at the end to avoid overflow.
The solution leverages the property that palindromes with an even number of digits are divisible by 11.
The search space for the first factor can be optimized.
The modulo 1337 is a common constraint in competitive programming to manage large numbers.
